availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George E. Harding (St. Louis, Missouri, merchant and bank president.)

body.p: St. Louis, Missouri, merchant and bank president. Kentucky native. Son of William L. Harding and America Harding. Married to Leannah McClelland in Logan County, Kentucky, in September 1848. Father of Nannie Harding, Clara Harding, and America Harding. Merchant in Logan County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Logan County in 1850. Merchant in St. Louis, Missouri, in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in St. Louis in 1860. President of Union Bank of Missouri in 1861. Owned Mike [Unknown] in St. Louis in 1863.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, Russellville.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Missouri, St Louis County, St Louis Ward 5, p. 342B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Logan County Marriages, Film 000364500.
Missouri, Wills and Probate Records, 1766-1988, St. Louis, Probate Court, 1816-1928, pgs. 195-197.
